dlgLine.text: When I heard someone was at the door, I didn't know they'd be bringing our friend Troy back.
Hey, Jefferson... listen, I know I said some things - maybe did some things that-
Shh... it's okay, Troy. How are you feeling? They taking care of you?
Uh... yeah. I guess things is pretty good. You know, not like it was here, but...
Oh, I'm glad to see you alive and well, boy. Now, Curtis... he took a turn for the worse after you left. You remember Curtis?
Yeah, I remember. Is he here? Figure I should apologize for what I done.
No, Troy... Curtis ain't here no more. 'Cept maybe in spirit.

dlgAnsw.text: What happened between Troy and Curtis?
I don't know what happened, but I'm sure it was an accident.

dlgLine.text: Okay, you got my attention. Now what?

dlgAnsw.text: I'm from a shelter in Splendid. Always happy to meet fellow survivors.
What's with the woman in the cage?
Give me 100 rations of food and 50 gallons of gas and I spare your men.
I was just waiting to get close to you, so I could do this... <Attack>

dlgLine.text: Make it quick...

dlgAnsw.text: I have something you want - let's trade.
About the woman in the cage...
Can you tell me more about the Texas Sons?
We're done. We'll have to pick this up another time.

dlgLine.text: Are we done?

dlgAnsw.text: I have something you want - let's trade.
About the woman in the cage...
Can you tell me more about the Texas Sons?

dlgLine.text: Not really your concern.
You fed and trained and probably invested a lot of time into Troy. I understand that and I aim to be fair. A hundred rations of food. No questions asked, you walk and he stays with us.
Now c'mon now - Jefferson, I'm still a Son, I can still be of use to you.

dlgAnsw.text: What are you going to do with him?
I can't do that - I won't leave Troy behind.
Can't believe I'm saying this... but if you want to get to Troy, you got to get through me.

dlgLine.text: Ninety rations. Young Mr. Cooper here's got to answer for his crime against the Sons. I advise you to make your own mind up real quick about my offer before I up and take him.

dlgAnsw.text: He's one of us - I'm not giving him up.
I won't sell out any of my people - I'm warning you.

dlgLine.text: Good. Troy - say goodbye and wait for me in the back.
Now wait a sec - after all I done! You're going to trade me like property! Bullshit! Y'all can't do this!
Take him outta my sight.
We going to take real good care of you,Troy boy.
Good. Troy - say goodbye and wait for me in the back.
Now wait a sec - after all I done! You're going to trade me like property! Bullshit! Y'all can't do this!
Take him outta my sight.
We going to take real good care of you,Troy boy.
Are you sure? Because now it's ninety cans. This doesn't have to be ugly - take the food.
I can't believe you're even having this conversation! What the hell, man?!

dlgAnsw.text: He's one of us - I'm not giving him up.
I won't sell out any of my people - I'm warning you.

dlgLine.text: Loyalty to your people... I can respect that. Okay, Troy, my boy - guess you get lucky this time. After all, we did kick you out.
Well... that's right. See, like I said - I don't need y'all. I got new friends now. And we're as tough as you, maybe even tougher!
Don't push your luck, boy.
Now, do you have any other reason to be here or are we done?
I know who you are. Get to the point.

dlgAnsw.text: Give me 100 rations of food and 50 gallons of gas and I spare your men.
I was just waiting to get close to you, so I could do this... <Attack>

dlgLine.text: See, I can already tell you're not too bright, 'cause I know before I came out all this way I would've asked myself - what can I offer the man who has everything?
Well, the answer, my friend, is jack and shit. Have yourself a good trip back now.

dlgAnsw.text: There has to be something you need.
You wouldn't have let me in if you didn't need something.
Then I guess I'll have to take it. <Attack>
Before I go, there's something else I need to ask you.

dlgLine.text: Heh... Maybe you're not so dumb after all. As it turns out, you are correct.
Could be...
There are a few ragtag groups of soldiers hitting my people here and there. Now, I could go out there and fight them, but every man I send out weakens my other positions.
I don't want my men shot or bit - but I'm willing to let someone else take that risk... I'm paying a bounty on soldiers. Bring me their dogtags as proof, I'll make it worth the trip.
<Paul whispers to you> I don't support this. Don't let them drag you into their fight.

dlgAnsw.text: You want me to kill soldiers?
Good to know. I may take you up on that.

dlgLine.text: Soldiers? No. Soldiers fight for a state, to defend their people and lands. That's what my people are doing.
Military...? They're nothing but murderers and thieves under a defunct banner.
I don't care what you do. But when they're tired at coming at us, who do you think they'll be coming for next?
And I'll have your bounty waiting here. If you manage it.
It's an open offer - you bag one, you come pay me a visit.
<The woman tries to talk despite a gag on her mouth and Jefferson puts a finger to his lips.>
She's a terrorist - an agent of the government that created this plague.
Muslim bitch.
Until she tells how to cure the disease, she's going to be staying right there.
<Whispers to you> We can't just leave that woman here.
<Whispers to you> We have to do something.

dlgAnsw.text: How do you know she created the disease?
You can't keep her in a cage!

dlgLine.text: No, I like her right there. For now.

dlgAnsw.text: You can't keep her in a cage!

dlgLine.text: She's CDC. Disease control - now you ever wonder why they're called that? Because it's a good way to get rid of the enemies of the US government.
Isn't that right? I said... isn't that right?!
<The woman struggles to speak and Jefferson laughs.>

dlgAnsw.text: You can't keep her in a cage!
Miss - I'm here to get you out! <Attack>

dlgLine.text: I can. And so can you, if you know what's good for you.
Oh ho...
Hold up, Filmore... I know our guests couldn't be stupid enough to demand I give them what's mine in my own damn country.
...Right?

dlgAnsw.text: I was hoping I would have to do this the hard way. <Attack>

dlgLine.text: Go ahead, Filmore.
Heh... Finally.

dlgAnsw.text: <All of the militia in the room begin their attack.>

dlgLine.text: Heh... Afraid I can't do that. But here's what I will give you...
...I'm waiting.

dlgAnsw.text: I have some dogtags for you.
How much would you trade for a cure to the bites?
Here's my offer - you give us 100 food and 50 gallons of fuel and I don't kill you.
Must have left it back in Splendid.

dlgLine.text: Maybe... Filmore, escort them out.
You heard the man - let's go.

dlgAnsw.text: <You follow Filmore to the front gate.>

dlgLine.text: Why you want to join? Not sure your kind might fit in here.
Like a damn hippie commune over in Splendid from what I hear.
Now, now... See, I don't hold it against you. You have your ways - that's fine for now. When these dead folk rot, be plenty of land for the queers, niggers, and Mexicans to go to.
But Texas - that's ours. We're in charge here. Ain't no government types left to take bread out of our mouths or force us to live next to degenerates.
This will truly be the land of the free. And any soldier, liberal, or half-breed that tries to stop us, well... I say let 'em try. We got plenty of ammunition.
<Whispers to you> Charming.
<Whispers to you> That's disgusting.

dlgAnsw.text: I have something else to discuss.

dlgLine.text: You see - can't even speak your mind around these types.
'Fraid I can't do that. It's become obvious that my people need a doctor...
But I'm willing to pay you a hefty price for them - 100 rations of food and 25 gallons of gas. I suggest you take it.

dlgAnsw.text: It's a generous offer... but I need a doctor more than supplies.
Throw in some rifles and ammo and we have a deal.
I accept... And tell them I'm sorry.
I left them in good faith. If anyone gets sick - you let us know and we'll bring the doctor back.
I thought about it - here's my counter offer. <Attack>
I thought about it - here's my counter offer. <Attack>

dlgLine.text: So do we...
Take the supplies. You're not getting your doctor back.

dlgAnsw.text: Throw in some rifles and ammo and we have a deal.
I left them in good faith. If anyone gets sick - you let us know and we'll bring the doctor back.

dlgLine.text: Good. Filmore bring over the supplies.
Packed and ready like you asked, Jefferson.
There you are. We're square.
Heh... Okay. Long as you don't use them on us. Filmore - get the stuff.
On it.
There you are. We're square.
You don't really have a choice. You either walk out of here with something or nothing. What's it going to be?

dlgAnsw.text: Throw in some rifles and ammo and we have a deal.
I left them in good faith. If anyone gets sick - you let us know and we'll bring the doctor back.
How about this - I walk out with my doctor and your head. <Attack>
How about this - I walk out with my doctor and your head. <Attack>

dlgLine.text: <Jefferson looks at his people.>
You better keep your word...
Get Ford...
Get the girl...
There.
Thank you for coming. Filmore's been having severe stomach pains for a few days now - where's the doctor?

dlgAnsw.text: Renee here can take care of him.
Ford here can take care of him.

dlgLine.text: What?! You're wasting my time and Filmore's - get them the hell out of here!
What are his symptoms?
Stomach pains - at first I thought it was food poisoning, but he's only gotten worse. Got to be something internal.
It's probably his appendix. I can do this... But it's going to take some time. And I'm going to want to monitor him overnight.
I appreciate this and I'll compensate you for the trip. Here's some fuel and food for your trouble. Come back tomorrow. And Miss, follow me...
What are his symptoms?
Stomach pains - at first I thought it was food poisoning, but he's only gotten worse. Got to be something internal.
It's probably his appendix. I can do this... But it's going to take some time. And I'm going to want to monitor him overnight.
I appreciate this and I'll compensate you for the trip. Here's some fuel and food for your trouble. Come back tomorrow. Doctor, follow me...
You? Okay... Follow me.
<You quickly come to the conclusion that Filmore's appendix needs to come out. After several hours, you finish up and do your best to stitch his wounds.>
I'm in your debt. Here's some food and fuel for your trouble. Now... If you don't mind, I'd like to be alone with my brother for a little bit.
Let's see them.

dlgAnsw.text: I have five. <+8 food, +2 gallons fuel>
This is what I want for one. <+6 food, +1 gallon fuel>
This is what I want for five. <+30 food, +5 gallons fuel>
My mistake - guess I left them in Splendid.

dlgLine.text: Another one for the collection.
Impressive.
You drive a hard bargain. But I'll pay it.
Five dead soldiers? Okay, I'll take them.
A cure! What is it this time? Blood transfusion? Magnets? Tonics? Leeches?
How many people you think have come around trying to sell a cure for the bites, huh?
No, forget it. I'll believe we have a cure when our songbird there produces one.
